chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tamya M Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tamya M Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Tamya M Smith.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his/her right to have an in-person hearing. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Tamya M Smith in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared on behalf of Mallory Davis for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests a Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing date. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Tamya M Smith in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Tamya M Smith in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Katherine Seelow for Mallory Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: James Pittman - MPD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.D.J. (dob 7/11/2020) If DMCPS closes out their investigation and Children's Court has no open orders, this order is to convert into a No Violent Contact Order.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tamya M Smith in court with  Student Intern Joe Furnstahl, appears under the student practice rule, under the supervision of attorney William Hotchkiss.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/27/2022 @01:30pm
